@Clint Burgamy, were you watching Joe Rogan when Elon was on there? The whole “grass fire” thing had me in a state of absolute shock and stupor! It wasn’t the fact that he would smoke weed, it was a twofold thing: that he would do it publicly, during a really popular podcast/livestream, and that he let Joe peer pressure him into it. I mean, the guy’s a genius billionaire. Tony Stark smoked weed, right (not Robert Downey Jr. The entire world knows about his younger days!😂😂 ⛄️⛄️⛄️⛄️❄️❄️❄️❄️❄️❄️❄️!!!!!!! But Elon’s got the entire world, just about, watching everything he does just to catch him slipping up so the media can tear him down. That COULD have ended SpaceX, Tesla and The Boring Company right there and cost thousands of people their jobs, or at the very least made their futures very shaky. He should have just waited for the final hour (I think that’s how long they had left) to be up and then toked up! Lots less drama and a lot lower lawyer bills for that month! Way to go SpaceX and keep hopping.

As Tim mentions early on the fact that SpaceX landing their first stage boosters has actually become routine, to the point that it's more astounding when they can't land, is just awesome.  Not that people can be bored with it, but the fact that it's becoming such a regular occurrence.  Just seems to me part of the route towards Elon and SpaceX's dream of making going to space as common ( and relatively cheap ) as getting on a plane to go across the country.  I'm not even 40 just yet, so at the pace they're going at I have a good chance of living long enough to see that happen.  Nice
